title: Delete unstarred thru a date range

creator: skipqc

title: Deleting OnStar messages through a certain date on Firefox
content: Hello is what I found for the instructions if this is still even available on firefox.. I cannot find a subject column or a date column or where to enable starred although I can enable stars all stars or all unstard but it doesn't limit it to just a range.. help please...Skip Chosen solution Right-click any column button, such as Subject, Date etc. and enable the Starred column. Then click the Starred column button to sort the list into starred and unstarred blocks. Select the first unstarred message, hold Shift and select the last unstarred message, press Delete.Jan 13, 2020
creator: skipqc

title: Recover deleted messages
content: Buongiorno, in passato per alcuni clienti ho utilizzato con successo il componente aggiuntivo "recoverDeletedMessages" sviluppato da Paolo Kaosmos Pagina dello sviluppatore. Il problema è che con la migrazione a Webextensions da parte di Mozilla l'autore ha deciso di abbandonare lo sviluppo dei suoi plugin. Non ho trovato nessun plugin che possa sostituirlo, nessuno ha pensato di riscriverlo? Per chi non lo conoscesse, il plugin in questione permetteva di di recuperare i messaggi cancellati (dalle cartelle non compattate) settando l'header X-Mozilla-Status a 0 (messaggio da leggere) nei messaggi cancellati.
creator: rollopack

title: Recover Deleted Messages
content: Good morning, In the past, I have successfully used the "recoverDeletedMessages" add-on developed by Paolo Kaosmos developer's page for some clients. The problem is that with Mozilla's migration to Webextensions, the author has decided to abandon the development of his plugins. I have not found any plugin that can replace it, has anyone thought of rewriting it? For those who are not familiar, the plugin in question allows you to recover deleted messages (from non-compacted folders) by setting the X-Mozilla-Status header to 0 (unread message) in deleted messages.
creator: rollopack

title: Duplicate notifications of new mail
content:
I am running Thunderbird 102.6.1 in a Windows 10 Pro environment. I am also using the QuickFolders and Provider for CalDAV & CardDAV extensions.

My Thunderbird is configured to work with four gmail.com accounts, all as POP rather than IMAP. Whenever I receive a new message I get the traditional "ding," and two minutes later I get the "ding" a second time. The messages, however, do not download more than one time each. The message count in the Windows 10 task bar shows double the number of messages that I actually have in my Inbox. This problem began happening sometime in mid-2022 and I cannot figure out what I did to cause it, or how to remedy it.

Anyone have a solution to this problem?

title: Thunderbird+Gmail setup failure
content:
I'm trying to set up Thunderbird (version 102.6.1, under Windows 10) to work with my Gmail account. I hope someone can help me understand what is happening.

First I enabled IMAP protocol in Gmail. Then I started "Add a new account" in Thunderbird and entered my name, email address, and email password. Thunderbird displayed details of the configuration it set for me, which looked correct: incoming, IMAP with SSL/TLS; outgoing, SMTP with SSL/TLS.

When I clicked Done, Thunderbird opened a browser window in which Gmail prompted me to sign in. The correct email address was prefilled.

I clicked Next and was prompted for the password; I entered the password and clicked Sign In.

Gmail displayed a page that asked whether Thunderbird should be allowed to access my account. I clicked Allow.

The browser window closed, returning me to the Thunderbird configuration screen, which displayed both of these messages:

  • (Yellow background) Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration username or password.
  • (Green background) (checkmark) Checking permission.

So, Thunderbird seems to be saying that Google failed to authenticate me, and simultaneously, that it's in the process of authenticating me (although it never reports that it has finished).

If Google failed to authenticate me, why did it prompt me to allow or deny Thunderbird access?

If Google successfully authenticated me, why does Thunderbird report that it failed?

One possible answer is that I entered my password correctly when Gmail prompted me, but entered it incorrectly in Thunderbird. But I tested that possibility by copying the password from the value I entered in Thunderbird and pasting it into Gmail's password prompt. Gmail said it was correct, so in Thunderbird it must also be correct.
creator: Jonathan.H

title: Net Hosting identified at initial Thunderbird mailserver startup
content:
Failed to join the web hosting product identified by Thunderbird when initializing the mail server and account.

Would anyone have the link to this service product?
creator: mkoopman283

title: Deleted messages from my Sent and Trash folders
content: Thunderbird is deleting messages from my sent and trash folders. Can this be stopped? I would like to keep messages in my sent and trash folders until I delete them.
creator: johnbluck_33

title: Using Thunderbird to clear my gmail of bacn
content:
After a long (health related) absence, I'd like to regain control of my gmail, with over a million emails and a bunch of labels that were relevant a decade ago, but not now. Plan of attack: 1. Sort ALLMAIL into labels of years received; emptying INBOX. 2. Open in TB, sort one "year label" at a time by sender, deleting unimportant msgs and unsubscribing ruthlessly. 3. Then return to gmail, delete obsolete labels and create a more relevant and sustainable set, while maintaining inbox.

My questions: A. Is there any part of the above that I cannot do in Thunderbird? B. My Thunderbird version is 78.14.0. When i click to update, it offers me version 91.0. When I go to Thunderbird's home page, it says the new release is 102. To what version should I update? My laptop's 5 year old: I'll put its specs at the bottom since I don't know which ones you'll want. C. I can't quite empty my gmail inbox! In the past of using TB, I always could. Now there are these dumb labels called primary and other things and even after disabling them I see different inbox numbers in TB itself, in gmail label system view, on that little header top right above inbox messages and in the inbox view itself. D. Thunderbird immediately shows the new 'year labels' but has not stopped downloading messages from all labels, old and new. Should I start from scratch after updating to new version?

Thank you for any assistance. _________________________________________________________________________________________ My laptop specs are as follows: ThinkPad Yoga X1 (2nd Gen) - New in 2018 Part No: 20JDCTO1WW-R90PFUPK Configuration Details ● Processor: Intel® Core™ i5-7300U Processor (3M Cache, up to 3.50 GHz) ● Operating System: Windows 10 Professional 64 - English ● Display Type: 14.0" WQHD (2560x1440) LED backlight, MultiTouch, IPS w/720p HD Camera ● Memory: 16GB 1866MHz LPDDR3 / soldered to systemboard ● Hard Drive: 1TB Solid State Drive M.2 ● Warranty: 1 Year Warranty ● Graphics: Intel® HD Graphics 620 ● Battery: 4-Cell Li-Polymer Battery (56Whr) ● Bluetooth: Bluetooth ● Wireless: Intel Dual Band Wireless-AC 8265, Wi-Fi 2x2 802.11ac + BT4.1, M.2 card
creator: thewhynotgirl

title: Password failed in Thunderbird
content: I have been using Thunderbird on a mac for years with no problems. Since yesterday, I have been getting login failed messages as my password is apparently incorrect. I am using macos 13.1, TB 102.6.1 and it is as a POP mail server. The error messages are attached. What is causing these failures? What login password is required? I have changed the password for this account everywhere I can find but these messages keep popping up every few minutes.
creator: hunterbr

title: Sent emails not saving and deleted emails not appearing in Trash
content: Emails I am sending are not all being saved in SENT folder Also emails I delete are not all showing in TRASH How can I fix this please? Using TB 102.6.1
creator: adzamnz

title: Address autocomplete not working for contacts on Exchange server
content:
Hello,

I use Thunderbird with the extensions "TbSync" and "Provider for Exchange ActiveSync" in order to communicate with our email server at work.

When composing a new email, I used to be able to start typing a person's name or email address and hit Tab and their email address would autocomplete (if multiple addresses were found for the name, a drop-down list would show). To do so, the autocomplete would look not only in the people I had already sent an email to at some point, but would also go through all the available addresses on our server. I loved this feature!

Since one update last year, the feature was suddenly gone - now it only goes through the people, that I have already sent emails to. I've searched for a solution multiple times, but have found nothing.

I would be really happy, if someone could help me fix this :)

Best regards!
creator: tihomir.varchev

title: Not able to send or receive pop3 or smtp for 4 days now.  Thunderbird generally is acting wonky.
content: For 4 days and nights I have unable to send or receive email messages. Maybe a software update from Mozilla/ Thunderbird. My ISP for 11 years refuses to say anything about 3rd party party programs, corporate headquarters in Denver, CO. I pointed out that all the programs on my desktop are all 3rd party program! But get this, Wideopenwest, hires a 3rd party company called Synacor to deal with email in and out, and supplies all the servers. End users like me are unable to reach Synacor corporate headquarters is in Buffalo, NY. My email address is [edited] @wowway.com. I do have a gmail account [edited] @gmail.com. I have used gmail as my backup. Perhaps the latest update to Thunderbird, has your code trying to glom onto my gmail account. I need my email! I gave money when I first downloaded Thunderbird. Send me the solution and I'll send more money to the foundation. EVERY program on my desktop works just fine, thank you very much. Please help. Thank you in advance, very much. ([removed phone# from public]) ~ Mike McManus
creator: macme
